400.description: The request URI does not match the APIs in the system, or the operation failed for unknown reasons. Invalid headers can also cause this error.

403.description: The requested operation is not permitted for the user. This error can also be caused by ACL failures, or business rule or data policy constraints.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. This can be caused by an ACL constraint or if the resource does not exist.

405.description: The HTTP action is not allowed for the requested REST API, or it is not supported by any API.

406.description: The endpoint does not support the response format specified in the request Accept header.

415.description: The endpoint does not support the format of the request body.
